Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can include different plants and animals, like fish, in their drawing.
The student can draw where the fish and other animals live, such as lakes, rivers, ponds, or oceans.
The student can show what fish and other living things need to survive, like water and plants.
The student can illustrate how the fish and plants are part of their natural environment.
The student can label parts of their drawing to show the relationship between the fish and their habitat.
The student can identify and label the resources that the habitat provides for the fish and plants to survive.
The student can show how the fishâ€™s environment and resources work together as a system.
